title: Escape Game-Based Learning Program for Improving Clinical Decision-Making in Emergency Medicine

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic emergency medical skills and patient assessment protocols, intermediate-level clinical experience
context.additional_context: Offline educational environment strengthening clinical judgment and collaborative skills through team-based problem-solving activities simulating real-life emergencies for current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can logically perform clinical judgments at three or more levels in emergency simulation scenarios.
Learners can determine optimal emergency care procedures through collaboration with peers within a limited timeframe.
Learners develop strategies to address five or more unpredictable variables that may occur in real clinical settings.

resources: Simulation Equipment (Model Human Body, Medical Tools)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
